ecominit(7) Miscellaneous Information Manual ecominit(7)

NAME

eComInit - service resource manager

DESCRIPTION

eComInit is a framework for the management of a system and its resources. It is modular in design and its component parts coordinate to track and manage resources.

An instance is the fundamental unit of eComInit. These are individual resources which are either a) directly managed by or b) monitored by eComInit. Instances are composed of properties which describe the characteristics and status of that resource.

All instances have a parent class. A class also has properties. Instances inherit the properties of their class, but can override these.

Naming

All classes and instances have a name. A class is named in reverse domain name notation. For example, here is a class name:

io.eComCloud.eci.repository

An instance has its own name within the class. The instance is then referred to from outwith the class by a System Resource Identifier, or SRI. An SRI always refers to an instance. It is composed of a class name, followed by a colon, followed by an instance name. For example:

io.eComCloud.eci.repository:default

If no instance name is specified, then the instance named default is referred to by default. Thus merely io.eComCloud.eci.repository is also equivalent to the above SRI.

Dependencies

A dependency is a kind of property. An instance which specifies a dependency is called a consumer of that dependency. The dependency specifies a citee instance on whose status the startup of the consumer is conditioned, and optionally also whose events may trigger the consumer's automatic restart and stop. An instance remains in the offline state until all its dependencies are satisfied.

Dependencies are regarded as satisfied or not according to the particular semantic of its kind:

Requires The cited instance must be online or degraded.
Optional The cited instance must be either be online or degraded, or it must be in an unsatisfiable state, e.g. because it has failed, is disabled, is incomplete, or any of this applies to any of its dependencies.
Conflicts The cited instance must be disabled, maintained, or not present.

Dependencies also denote conditions under which the consumer will be automatically restarted in response to events that occurred to the citee. There are four such restart conditions:

Never There are no conditions under which the restart of the citee will cause the consumer to be restarted.
On-Error The consumer will be restarted if the citee restarts due to an error.
On-Restart The consumer will be restarted if the citee restarts for any reason.
On-Refresh The consumer will be restarted if the citee is refreshed, or if it restarts for any reason.
